description: A peaceful island in Paradise known for its annual fireworks festival, a tradition maintained for 400 years. The island features a mountainous region where the master pyrotechnician's workshop is located, and hosts celebrations that attract visitors from surrounding areas.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Arrive at Fireworks Island
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates dock at Fireworks Island during preparations for its annual fireworks festival.
keyEvents.significance: The setting for Usopp's character-focused adventure and introduction to the island's 400-year firework tradition.

keyEvents.title: Successful Launch of Ball 205
keyEvents.description: The massive Ball 205 firework is successfully launched over the island, creating a spectacular display of white falling stars that honors both tradition and innovation.
keyEvents.significance: The climactic moment that brings together the island's 400-year heritage with modern problem-solving.

statusHistory.reason: Peaceful island with ongoing festival tradition

description: A workshop atop the mountain on Fireworks Island where master pyrotechnician Odama creates fireworks. The workshop contains the massive Ball 205 firework and houses the ancient launch platform tower, a 400-year-old structure used for launching 200-gauge shells.

keyEvents.title: Usopp Arrives at Workshop
keyEvents.description: Usopp reaches the mountaintop workshop and meets Odama for the first time.
keyEvents.significance: The primary setting for the episode's story and where the Ball 205 is stored.

keyEvents.title: Ball 205 Revealed
keyEvents.description: Kodama shows Usopp the enormous Ball 205 firework stored in the workshop.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals the central object of the episode's plot.

description: A 400-year-old tower structure specifically designed for launching massive 200-gauge firework shells. Located within Odama's workshop, this ancient platform represents the traditional knowledge that had been forgotten over generations but is rediscovered in time to safely launch the Ball 205.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of the Ancient Launch Platform
keyEvents.description: The tower in Odama's workshop is revealed to be a 400-year-old launch platform designed for 200-gauge shells.
keyEvents.significance: Connects the present to the past, showing that the solution existed in their heritage all along.

keyEvents.title: Ball 205 Launched from Ancient Platform
keyEvents.description: Using the rediscovered ancient launch platform and Usopp's pulley system, the Ball 205 is successfully launched.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates how traditional wisdom and modern innovation can work together.

statusHistory.reason: Traditional knowledge of platform's purpose was lost over generations
Rediscovered and used successfully to launch Ball 205

description: A cemetery on Fireworks Island where Kodama's parents are buried. This quiet place serves as a location for reflection and where Kodama goes to feel close to her deceased parents.

keyEvents.title: Usopp's Wisdom at the Cemetery
keyEvents.description: Usopp finds Kodama at her parents' graves and helps her understand the true meaning of their dream.
keyEvents.significance: The pivotal emotional scene where Kodama learns that she is her parents' true dream.
